intro: Trichodesma heliocharis, commonly known as the sunflower tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree with a rounded crown and smooth, greyish bark. The plant produces bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Trichodesma heliocharis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
